results.summary: A man suspected of stabbing a pregnant woman in a Birmingham car park is named by police.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/389efce4-0b42-ea42-98c4-d221403ea1fc"><image id="68510562"/><paragraph role="introduction">A man suspected of stabbing a pregnant woman in a Birmingham car park has been named by police.</paragraph><paragraph>Leon Harrison, 33, is thought to have left the Fitness First car park in Stirchley in a silver car after the stabbing at about 14:00 BST on Monday.</paragraph><paragraph>Officers urged anyone who sees Mr Harrison to call 999 and not approach him.</paragraph><paragraph>The victim, who is known to Mr Harrison, is in a critical but stable condition in hospital.</paragraph><paragraph>Police said the woman, 31, was in the early stages of pregnancy.</paragraph><paragraph>Mr Harrison, from Kings Heath, is also known to visit Selly Oak and the Lickey Hills area of Worcestershire.</paragraph><crosshead>Panther tattoo</crosshead><paragraph>He is described as black, 6ft 2ins, heavily built with brown eyes and a small goatee beard and four "gold canine teeth".</paragraph><paragraph>West Midlands Police said he had a distinctive panther tattoo on his right arm and a large cross on his lower left arm.</paragraph><paragraph>He also has letters tattooed on both sides of his neck and a scar on the right side of his jaw.</paragraph><paragraph>Detectives said they also wanted to speak to the male driver of a blue Renault vehicle who was leaving the car park in Pershore Road as the attack happened.</paragraph><paragraph>Det Insp Justin Spanner said officers were trawling CCTV in the area and had visited a number of addresses known to Mr Harrison.</paragraph></body>
results.shortFormBody: <shortFormBody xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/389efce4-0b42-ea42-98c4-d221403ea1fc"><paragraph>A man suspected of stabbing a pregnant woman in a Birmingham car park has been named by police.</paragraph><paragraph>Leon Harrison, 33, is thought to have left the Fitness First car park in Stirchley in a silver car after the stabbing at about 14:00 BST on Monday.</paragraph><paragraph>Officers urged anyone who sees Mr Harrison to call 999 and not approach him.</paragraph><paragraph>The victim, who is known to Mr Harrison, is in a critical but stable condition in hospital.</paragraph></shortFormBody>

68510562.caption: Leon Harrison is described as having four "gold canine teeth" and distinctive tattoos

items.summary: A woman is in a life-threatening condition after being stabbed several times in a car park in Birmingham.
items.headline: Stirchley stabbing: Woman attacked in car park
items.shortHeadline: Woman stabbed in city car park

results.headline: Leon Harrison named as Stirchley pregnant woman stabbing suspect
